newsitem.title: FRANCE: French car sales fall 21 pct in March - CCFA.
newsitem.headline: French car sales fall 21 pct in March - CCFA.

text.p: New car registrations in France fell 21 percent in March to 151,586 units, the French carmakers association CCFA said on Monday.
On a comparable-day basis, the fall was 17.1 percent, it said in a statement. There were 20 working days last month, compared with 21 in March 1996.
For the first three months of the year, car sales in France are down 26.5 percent compared with the year-earlier quarter.

"These results, while an improvement over recent months, show the market suffers from the sales pulled forward by the rebate incentives," the CCFA said. Orders surged ahead of the expiry last September of a rebate scheme as carbuyers rushed to take advantage of discounts. But orders have slumped since then.
The French carmakers, Renault and PSA Peugeot Citroen, held 55.4 percent of the market in March and foreign carmakers had 44.6 percent.
Renault's new car sales fell 23.3 percent, giving it a 28 percent market share. PSA group sales fell 25.1 percent, leaving it with 27.4 percent of the French car market last month.
